ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Improved Spanish speaking and fluency. Learned a lot of grammar and culture
Further knowledge of Spanish and culture in Latin America and Spain.
I greatly advanced my knowledge of Spanish, especially of vocabulary and grammar structures.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths: my Spanish definitely improved in grammar and confidence when speaking, asynchronous Wednesdays made the work more manageable 
weaknesses: felt very intense and strict in class, sometimes it felt like students were picked on when they made mistakes; also felt like a lot of busywork that didn't help improve my Spanish.
I love Sra. Asensio. That's my queen. The classroom environment felt really personal and individualized, so I actually was challenged to learn but nurtured.

This course definitely packs a lot of content in which can be overwhelming but the activities were fun and interesting. It was very intense and exhausting though, and at times the project guidelines were a little bit unclear.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! You will learn a lot and also get to explore topics of interest to you in Spanish
